Objective.evidence: To evaluate the efficacy of electroacupuncture (EA) intervention on myocardial protection and postoperative rehabilitation in patients undergoing cardiac surgery with cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB).

Number_Randomised.evidence: Fourteen RCTs involving 836 patients were included.

Result_Outcome.evidence: EA significantly increased the incidence of cardiac automatic rebeat after aortic unclamping [relative risk ( RR ) = 1.15, 95% confidence interval ( CI ) (1.01, 1.31), P < 0.05; moderate].

Harms.evidence: No adverse reactions related to EA were reported in any of the included studies.
